newsitem.title: CHILE: CHILE, ARGENTINA MINING TREATY NEARLY READY-MENEM.
newsitem.headline: CHILE, ARGENTINA MINING TREATY NEARLY READY-MENEM.

text.p: Chile and Argentina expect to sign a border mining treaty within 60 days after delays in agreeing on maps attached to the accord, Argentine President Carlos Menem said on Friday.

"The treaty is practically finished in most aspects, but we need to consult with two provinces in the south of Argentina...over cartography," Menem said a joint news conference with President Eduardo Frei.
"We will be able to send the agreement in not more than 60 days to our parliaments," the Argentine president said.
The treaty, which governs bilateral mining projects in border areas in the Andes, was due to have been signed by both leaders during Menem's official visit to Chile.
Menem and Frei signed six other agreements in a ceremony at the Moneda presidential palace including accords on border posts and on mutual help in the event of catastrophes.
Menem arrived in Chile Thursday for the official opening of the GasAndes natural gas pipeline running across the Andes from the Argentine city of Mendoza to Santiago.
